I understand that you are looking for more innovative questions. One way to make the question more innovative is by making the problem more open-ended and allowing students to explore different problem-solving methods. Here is an example of an open-ended question that uses the Pythagorean Theorem:

"A right triangle has a hypotenuse with length 20 and one leg with length x. Using the Pythagorean Theorem, create an equation that relates x to the length of the other leg. Then, use the equation to find the possible lengths of the other leg and explain the reasoning behind your answers."
